thread.title: Park City Curling Club's 12 oz Curlers beat the Alpine Sweepers 8 to 7 in OT
thread.title_full: Park City Curling Club's 12 oz Curlers beat the Alpine Sweepers 8 to 7 in OT

author: Michele Roepke
title: Park City Curling Club's 12 oz Curlers beat the Alpine Sweepers 8 to 7 in OT
text:
Sports Park City Curling Club’s 12 oz Curlers beat the Alpine Sweepers 8 to 7 in OT Michele Roepke
9 hours ago
Park City Curling Club at the Park City Ice Arena welcomed US Veterans with the National Ability Center in this photo in a previous event from December. Results writen below for this week's able-bodied tournament. Photo: Park City Curling Club
PARK CITY, Utah — The Park City Curling Club tournament Park City Ice Arena this week shook up the standings, unseating previous leaders Curls For Girls in the second match of the winter season, which opened Jan. 6.
“Energy in the arena was great,” wrote club administrators on Facebook. “Great to see so many new curlers in our league this year! Good curling!” They added, “Curling is growing in Park City.”
Similar Reads On TownLift Their next Learn to Curl session for all-comers is on January 20, 8 – 10 p.m., sign up here.
Similar Reads On TownLift TAGGED: Park City Curling Club LOCATION: Park City, Utah By: Michele Roepke Contact: mroepke@townlift.com
I've lived in Park City for 30 years but right off the starting line, my journalism professors expressed plaudits after class for writing more so about the small-town sports in the surrounding mountains than the urban updates they assigned. Therefore, I’m on par punning and penning Parkites' pastimes. Turning high and early through my career, I’ve worked communications for The Olympics, the Paralympics and the Special Olympics. Additionally, there's been National Geographic, Patagonia, NCAA, USA Nordic and the United States Library of Congress, so I guess you could say this ain't my first rodeo.
